item.description:
This is cross-posted with a New Haven Collective SantaDancing meetup

Hot on the heels of Santacon is SantaDance!

Come to Playwright, in holiday costume, and dance the night away!

We'll gather in the front room area, music is supposed to start around 9:30/10, look for us in front, back, or both.

Nothing cancels SantaDance, not even a lack of attendance. I danced late at night after Santacon as a lone elf and had a great time! I'll be elfing-it-out again on Friday, come join me!

COME IN FULL COSTUME! Just wearing a hat doesn't count.

COSTUME IDEAS/PICS: Be a Santa, elf, toy, Christmas caroler, character from a Dickens novel, dreidel, ornament, reindeer, tree, snowman, snowflake, the Grinch, Hanukah Harry.... Naughty-girl-who-deserves-coal (there were a few at Santacon) DOES count...just make it Christmas-y. Or just wear red, green, a scarf, and wrap yourself in some garland.

For costume inspiration, see these photos from Santacon 2009

Check the Santacon site for ideas on where to buy costumes (local stores like Costume Bazaar and Party City). Or just check your local Walgreens, Target, dollar store, etc.

If you're a Facebooker, you can RSVP here or there on the FB event.

HOST: Jason, 203-901-4957 (texting is fine). But don't expect me to notice my phone Friday night! Just come!
